title: I'm looking for this script font
content:
I've tried enhancing the image and splitting up the letters to run it through a font recognition site. I've also tried searching manually.

The key factors I was using to try and identify this font are the slight right slant, extended crossing to the lowercase 't', and how the 'n' is written with spaced out "humps".

Any help would be greatly appriciated!

Thanks,  
-Will

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073320im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Font3b_4557.JPG)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Font3b.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073320/http:/typophile.com/files/Font3b.JPG) | 10.53 KB |
author: wzorn

comments.content:
**[Mr Sheffield](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073320/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Sudtipos%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Mr%20Sheffield%20-%20Regular&fid=fdf5df963bbca42b10db6633c41aa286&fsize=60&text=and%20dancing%20to%20follow&fit=1)** by Sudtipos [2004]  
(I used **[Find my Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073320/http:/www.findmyfont.com/)**'s magnification/contrast tool twice and then selected /g/t/f/l/ to identify the font)
Wow. Nice job! That's exactly it. Thanks!! I'm going to try what you did and see if I can get the same results.
